title: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, there should be a confirmation that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. This is because some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and selects an existing directory structure for it, the confirmation dialog does not appear to check if the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: When a user creates a new project and selects an existing directory structure for it, a confirmation dialog should appear to check if the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
1. Open the project creation dialog.
2. Select an existing directory structure for the project.
3. Specify the output folder as the bin directory.
4. Click on the 'Create Project' button.
5. Verify that a confirmation dialog appears asking for permission to delete and rebuild the output directory.
